result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L. Vesper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: per JCSD Defendant paid the fine // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called at 3:47pm [mo]
Defendant Amanda L. Vesper in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court gives Ms. Vesper her right to counsel ; Ms. Vesper indicates that she would like to proceed without counsel
The Court finds that Ms. Vesper is competent to proceed without counsel
The Court finds that Ms. Vesper is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving her right to counsel
The Court accepts Mr. Vesper's waiver of counsel

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any previously imposed sentence; to commence on   3/21/2016 at 7:00pm
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Ms. Vesper is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge= $543, to be paid by 4/10/2016; non-payment shall result in a  11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess: 4:00pm

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda L. Vesper
Current: 105 Aztalan St. Lot #16, Johnson Creek, WI 53038 United States  (Effective: 02-04-2016)
Prior: N3525 Trieloff Rd Apt 214, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 11:18 am [sf] {Commissioner Weber presiding for Br. 2}
Defendant Amanda L. Vesper in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

DOB and address verified with the defendant.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Plea of "guilty" entered
Commissioner Weber advises that she is unable to sentence, and advises that she could see if another Judge is available or schedule a plea and sentencing date for another date and time.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Court and defendant discuss if she would like time to discuss the case with the State. Defendant indicates that she would like time to discuss case with the State, was entering "not guilty" plea because she didn't want to take to many days off of work.
Court enters a plea of "not guilty" on the defendant's behalf

Court continues the $150.00 CASH bond, with additional conditions: 
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession of alcohol outside of employment purposes
-No consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores except where she is employed
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Leslie Omit

recess: 11:29 pm
NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 2/17/16 at 3:40 pm- Send notices (2) Plea and Sentencing scheduled for 3/10/16 at 3:45 pm
